feature.label: Xsemantics Implemented Examples
feature.description:
This feature contains the implementation of some examples of languages which use Xsemantics for implementing the type system and the semantics/interpreter. You can then try such examples in your Eclipse, using the wizards to create projects for such example DSLs.
Xsemantics is a DSL (implemented in Xtext itself) for writing type systems, reduction rules, interpreters (and in general relation rules) for languages implemented in Xtext. It then generates Java code that can be used in your language implemented in Xtext for scoping and validation (it can also generate a validator in Java).
